sect1.title: Keeping the System Up-to-date
sect1.para: &suse; offers a continuous stream of software security patches for your product. The update applet informs you about the availability of patches and lets you easily install them with just a few clicks.
sect1.remark: 2007-08-06 - fs: In order to differentiate between official updates and new program versions, the official updates are referred to as "patches" contrary to "New (program) versions".

sect2.title: Using the GNOME Update Applet
sect2.para: The update applet resides in the notification area of the panel. Its icon changes depending on the availability and relevance of patches and the status of the update. To invoke the applet manually, choose Computer More Applications System Software Update .

note.title: Icon visibility
note.para: The applet icon is only visible if the following conditions are met:

listitem.para: the GUI was not started as user &rootuser;
the GUI was not started in a VNC session

note.para: To start the update viewer even if no applet icon is visible, press F2 and enter gpk-update-viewer.

listitem.para: The update applet is busy (for example checking for updates or installing software).

varlistentry.term: Orange Star with an Up Arrow
Yellow Star with a Down Arrow

sect3.title: Installing Patches

step.para: Whenever new patches are available, a notification message will appear and the &gupdater; icon will be visible in the notification area. Either click Install updates in the notification message or click the icon to open the Software Update window.

All security and important patches are preselected. It is strongly recommended to install these patches. Trivial patches can be manually selected by ticking the respective check boxes. Get detailed information on a patch by clicking on its title.
Click Install Updates to start the patch installation.
The Additional Confirmation Required window showing an installation summary opens. Click Continue to proceed.
Enter the &rootuser; password in the authentication screen and proceed with Authenticate.

sect3.para: The &yast; Online Update offers advanced features to customize the patch installation. Please refer to for more information.

sect3.title: Configuring the Software Update Applet
sect3.para: To configure the update applet, right-click the update icon in the panel and choose Preferences. The configuration dialog lets you modify the following settings:

listitem.para: Choose how often a check for updates is performed: Hourly, Daily, Weekly, or Never.
Configure whether patches are installed automatically or not (default). Automatic installation can be chosen for either security patches only or for all patches.
Choose how often a check for major upgrades is performed: Daily, Weekly, or Never.

varlistentry.term: Check for updates when using mobile broadband

listitem.para: This configuration option is only available on mobile computers. Turned off by default.

sect3.para: More options are configurable using gconf-editor: apps gnome-packagekit.
